tool.name: Process and Normalize RCC Files
tool.description: Process and normalize RCC output from nanostring.
tool.command: #for $num, $file in enumerate($rcc) ln -s $file input${num}.RCC && #end for python $__tool_directory__/proc_norm.py #for $num, $file in enumerate($rcc) input${num}.RCC #end for --samplesheet "${samplesheet}" --abfile "${ab_reference}" #if $ctrl -ctrl #end if

param.name: samplesheet
param.label: Samplesheet
param.help: Samplesheet is tab delimited of RCC file name in column 1 and sample name in column 2.

param.name: ab_reference
param.label: ANTIBODY_REFERENCE.csv
param.help: antibody_reference file changes antibody names from the existing ones in RCC files

param.name: ctrl
param.label: Normalize using all samples
param.help: YES = Normalize using all RCC samples. NO = Normalize only using cell lines MCF7, HCC1954, BT474, HeyA8, MDA468 control, MDA468control, MDA468+EGF as controls

tool.help:
This tool takes multiple RCC files, the output from Nanostring. There is an RCC file per sample in a batch of Nanostring data.
*Input*: - RCC files - Nanostring Samplesheet - antibody reference file
*Output*: - rawdata.txt: tab-delimited file with the raw data from nanostring - run_metrics.txt: tab-delimited file with run and lane quality metrics - corrected tables: rawdata numbers corrected for: 1. ERCC control, loading contro 2. Sample level mean for all antibodies per sample 3. Immunoglobulin ratio
